text:
Spacebase Chip-1
Small Magellanic Cloud
AVA: Wow! What an awful day! Everything's gone wrong today!
CINDY: That's why I, Captain Cynthia "Cindy" Palisade of the Spacebase Chip--
BOB: ...
CINDY: I know, Lieutenant Bob, you know who I am.
CINDY: I've just been so excited since getting my promotion.
CINDY: In any case, ever since the no communication theorem was lifted, I know you all have been glued to the news coming from Earth.
AVA: Earth?! My food replicator's been out all day and no one has done anything to fix it! I don't even remember which planet Earth is!
I just want a banana!
NELEHU: Perhaps it was due to misuse. The amount of matter in the universe is limited, after all.
AVA: Excuse me?!
CINDY: In any case! The Earth has been encased in a quantum field! Quantum ships patrol the Milky Way galaxy! The Amalgamation of Worlds... is at war.
AVA: Question. What's a war?
CINDY: And I was about to say, the only one in the entire Amalgamation who's defeated quantum before... is Ava.
BOB: ...
CINDY: I don't think I'd have put it like that, Lieutenant, but you have a good point. Ava, it's been awhile since you've done quantum stuff. Do you remember how it works?

AVA: Of course I remember! You grab the photon and the antiphoton and they merge, and then there's... there's a cat involved, and... well, Lily helped me with the math a bit, but I'm sure it'll come right back!
NELEHU: Don't worry. Perhaps our new overlords will be more respectful of limited resources.
AVA: I'm sure it'll come right back to me if I try!
BOB: ...
CINDY: That's a great idea, Lieutenant! Nelehu, you can set up a quantum field in the landing bay. I'm sure Ava will get right back into the swing of things with a little practice!
AVA: Yeah... I'll do just fine...
*gulp*
AVA: See! I knew I could do it! So now we need to go and save the Earth! That's the one with the rings, right?
NELEHU: This is Lieutenant Nelehu. We have a minor issue.
CINDY: Minor?! Nelehu, this is no time for understatement!
AVA: What's going on in there?
CINDY: Hang tight, Ava! You might have to stay in the quantum world just a little longer.
CINDY: Oh my editor! They're getting into my computer, I swear if they delete any of my manuscripts
*beep*
AVA: That's not particularly reassuring...
AVA: I don't think these are just test chambers anymore... what's going on in here?
???: Wouldn't you like to know!
MAN: Hahaha! Halt in the name of quantum!
AVA: But we're in an entirely different galaxy! How did you make it over here so quickly?
MAN: We used quantum teleportation! Haven't you ever heard of spooky action at a distance?
Now that we've escaped the confines of the black hole, the entire universe will be placed inside a quantum field! It's what you deserve!
AVA: And what's with the giant eye balls! Those are weirding me out just a little.
MAN: You can't have quantum without the observers!
AVA: But this all doesn't make sense... I met Schrodinger's Cat, you all just wanted to stay inside the black hole. Why would you leave now? What's changed?
MAN: Schrodinger's cat is gone! They were weak and lost to the likes of you! We've got new leadership now!
MAN: But enough talk! Shut up and calculate!
CINDY: Good work Ava! I can't believe quantum superposition is still valid over this distance!
As captain, I'll be taking the first author slot on this paper, of course.
MAN: Of course, this is only a minor setback for Quantum.
Hahaha! You still haven't calculated anything!
MAN: Principled retreat!
CINDY: It would have been nice to have a prisoner...
NELEHU: It is likely for the best.
AVA: What do we do now?
CINDY: The same thing we were going to do before. We're going to get into the Starship Zip-A, and we're going to beat quantum!
CINDY: Bob, I can count on you to hold down the fort while we're gone, right?
BOB: ...
CINDY: Then it's set! Onwards... to the Milky Way Galaxy!

Starship Zip-A
Intergalactic Void
NELEHU: Ava, are you even paying attention?
How are you ever going to defeat quantum if you can't understand a simple diagram?
AVA: I'm awake! I h-bar d-psy dt equals the Hamiltonian!
NELEHU: Please try to take this seriously...
AVA: But I wasn't wrong...
COMPUTER: Red alert detected. All hands hide under the nearest desk. Duck and cover. Red alert detected.
CINDY: What's going on? Why is the quantum theme playing? Lieutenant Nelehu, status report!
NELEHU: The ship is not pleased. It appears that we have been placed within a quantum field.
AVA: But that's impossible! We'd notice, time would be moving all weird and I'd only be able to move a step at a time!
See, look, I can jump around just fine!
NELEHU: Nevertheless, that is what the ship reports.
CINDY: But if the quantum field is in space, then we can't just send Ava in. We'll need to dissipate it somehow...
AVA: Um, this is probably a silly question, but... we have those mirrors in the hold, could we use those to form anti-photon/photon pairs? And dissipate the field that way?
NELEHU: That idea is simply more proof that you need to pay attention to...
CINDY: That's a great idea! Lieutenant, can you direct the ship's tractor beam? If we can boost the engine power we should be able to break the field just long enough for it to dissipate itself.
NELEHU: ...
NELEHU: I will be busy with tuning the engine. I would recommend our navigator instead is best-suited to the task.
AVA: Wait, that's me, isn't it?
NELEHU: Unless, of course, you'd prefer to provide an analytical solution to the Dirac equation?
AVA: I'll head over to my console...
AVA: Oh yeah! I'm doing great! No puny quantum field can stop Captain Ava!
NELEHU: Hahaha!
AVA: I mean Ensign Ava I was just having a little fun come on don't tell Cindy I want her job please she might not be as nice as Harmony was
NELEHU: Don't you see? I've joined quantum and decided to betray all of you! Be silent and compute!
AVA: Oh no! What are we going to do now!
NELEHU: Hahahaha!
CINDY: Oh hey Ava, I wanted to let you know that someone's affixed some mirrors to the fabric of spacetime, so this might be harder to
CINDY: Editors forbid! Nelehu's joined quantum! We're all doomed! Throw them in the brig! Do we even have a brig? Red alert!
COMPUTER: Red alert detected. All hands hide under the nearest desk. Duck and cover. Red alert detected.
NELEHU: No, no, I was just trying to spook Ava, there's no alert, I haven't betrayed anyone...
CINDY: Lieutenant Nelehu.
NELEHU: I'll go button up my jacket...
CINDY: Pick up your jaw from the floor, Ensign. You'll never get my job acting like that!
AVA: Ah, yes, of course!
COMPUTER: Welcome to the Milky Way Galaxy. Over one hundred billion served.
AVA: We made it! The quantum field is officially dissipated!
CINDY: Great work, Ava! Now we're on our way to Earth!
NELEHU: About that. I was speaking with the ship, and
COMPUTER: Quantum detected ahead.
CINDY: Again?!
AVA: They're in the Betelgeuse system. We should be able to avoid that.
CINDY: After Betelgeuse went supernova, we put a lot of effort to put that star back together. It was probably one of the great achievements of our civilization.
NELEHU: Lieutenant Bob would've said it better than me, however, I must point out that-
CINDY: I know you all know that part! But what you probably don't know is that we don't know why we did it. There's no civilization that we know of. The star's just been left alone since then.
But someone might be out there in the system. We can't just leave them alone to deal with Quantum! Ensign! Open a communication channel.
AVA: Ah, yes, I didn't mean to say we'd abandon anyone... of course!
*beep*
???: This is Betelgeuse. We have no need of your assistance. Everything is under control. Make no attempts to get closer. We will stop you.
AVA: Looks like everything's under control!
???: That was also fine. This is under control. We're quite serious.
???: And also not bluffing. Say that part!
*beep*
AVA: I'm not sure about this...
CINDY: What can we really do? If they don't want our help...
NELEHU: I fail to understand why an organization called Quantum would want to occupy a star. Stars are governed by gravity, which is not compatible with quantum physics.
CINDY: Unless they're trying to figure out a grand unified theorem...
CINDY: But I wanted to be the one to do that! Ava, hope you brought sunscreen, we're sending you in!
AVA: Wow it's hot out here... But not too bad otherwise!
I wonder why Quantum always likes to leave those boxes lying around.
BLUE ???: Didn't we tell you we could handle this ourselves?
AVA: But there were like, explosions and stuff! Clearly you needed help! I'm just here to deal with quantum!
See! Explosions!
BLUE ???: We're the bun-
PINK ???: What my friend here means is that it doesn't matter who we are! This star blew up once, we're not letting it blow up again! That made a hell of a mess!
AVA: I'm not trying to blow up the star! I'm not even sure why I'm here! I was trying to save Earth! You know, the red planet!
BLUE ???: Well, don't expect our help! In fact, we might just try to get in your way! Bunny--
PINK ???: Look, what my probably-not-hareish friend here means is, we're out! But you'll see us again!
AVA: That probably could've gone better... I thought it was bad enough having to deal with Quantum.
PINK ???: Admit it! Where is she? You really thought you could get away with this, didn't you? Well time's up!
AVA: I have no idea what you're talking about! I told you, I'm here to fight quantum, not whoever you are! We're standing on a red giant, anyone could get lost!
PINK ???: Likely story! Now let me tell you something!
PINK ???: Oh no...
MAN: Looking for someone?
BLUE ???: Pink! Don't trust the black-haired girl! This is probably all her fault somehow!
AVA: Wait, what did I do? I'm here to defeat quantum!
MAN: Defeat us? That's simply laughable. Do you have any idea who I am?
AVA: Uh... can't say that I do.
MAN: Really? Not even a little? That's disappointing... I guess when you live in a black hole news doesn't get out.
MAN: You can call me Mossbauer! Master of Iron-57! And tell me, ignorant ones, where is Iron forged?
PINK ???: In the heart of stars when they go supernova. Everyone knows that.
AVA: Yeah, what she said!
PINK ???: So that's your plan, is it? Cause the star to go supernova?
MOSSBAUER: That's right. Very astute. But that knowledge won't help you. I've been slowly saturating the environment with Iron-57. It lives in your blood.
In the wild, iron 57 is only point zero two percent of iron. But in your bodies now, it is nearly 25%. Which means I control a quarter of your movements.
Still think you can beat me?
MOSSBAUER: Impossible! To think I was defeated by a bunch of degenerate bosons...
Perhaps it would have been wiser to stick with potassium. Alas! Just one sip remains.
AVA: Now do you believe me? I was just here to stop them, and now that I'm done, it's back on the ship and off to Venus!
PINK ???: I guess we owe you an apology. While we were wasting time trying to stop you, the star was almost blown up by the people you had warned us about and were trying to stop!
AVA: I hope you learned an important lesson today!
PINK ???: I wouldn't go that far...
AVA: Well, I guess any apology is good enough. I'm off! Remember to rate the Spaceship Zip-A five stars!
PINK ???: But this isn't a quinary system; there's only one star here...
BLUE ???: I just have one thing to say about all this...
BLUE ???: Isn't anyone going to untie me?!

Neptune Orbit
Solar System
AVA: We made it! Now in orbit around the blue planet, and I detect a quantum field below.
CINDY: Ensign Ava... I'm not sure this is the right planet. The distress signal was from Earth, remember?
AVA: I thought Earth was the blue planet?
Don't tell me this star system has more than one blue planet...
CINDY: Well, we're in a ship capable of traveling between galaxies, going from one planet to another should be a breeze!
AVA: Yes, of course! Computer, set a course to the... third? is that right? The third planet!
COMPUTER: Nope.
AVA: Uh, computer, what? Just move the ship!
COMPUTER: Can't do it.
CINDY: Computer! Stop messing around! The entire Amalgamation is at stake!
COMPUTER: Unable to comply.
AVA: What's going on! I've never had the computer act like this before!
CINDY: Maybe Quantum's infiltrated this ship too... I should've backed up my manuscripts.
NELEHU: Sorry I'm late, I was off screen. What's going on?
AVA: Nelehu! The ship's refusing to move us from one planet to another!
NELEHU: Computer. Explain yourself.
COMPUTER: We are currently out of fuel.
AVA: Why didn't you just say that, computer!
COMPUTER: You didn't ask.
CINDY: Oh right... the ship needs fuel... I was definitely going to check that before calling a red alert...
NELEHU: I wanted to warn you of this earlier when we were messing about on Betelgeuse.
I suppose therefore this is also my responsibility.
CINDY: It doesn't matter whose fault it is. We need to get some fuel.
NELEHU: There is an Amalgamation settlement in orbit around Neptune. We should be able to get fuel from them.
AVA: About that... I detected a quantum field below. I think the Neptune station also has been taken over by quantum.
NELEHU: Then we'll simply have to eliminate quantum from the surface, as we did elsewhere.
AVA: And by 'we' you mean 'me'!
CINDY: What's wrong, Ava? You were more willing to do this before...
AVA: Well, about that... In orbit over the planet, gravity will be much lower... I've never had to jump in quantum space. I don't know if it'll work.
CINDY: Is that all, Ava? You'll do great! Just try to picture some giant golden arrows in possible directions, maybe that'll help.
AVA: I guess that might help...
NELEHU: I must admit that you are not only our only hope, Ava, but you are therefore our best hope.
AVA: Well! I'm feeling a little better now. I guess I won't know what it's like until I head down... Wish me luck!
AVA: I've never visited Neptune before. Doesn't seem to be a very happening place.
WOMAN: Get out of here, Quantum scum! On this planet we maintain determinism and local realism!
AVA: Ahhh! Who are you?
WOMAN: Name's Antonia, Grand Duchess and Imperial Cupbearer of Neptune Province...
...And I just noticed your Amalgamation pin. Sorry about that.
AVA: I guess the whole galaxy has it hard dealing with the Quantum attack... I'm Ensign Ava Marie St. Janet Crispin VII, from the Spaceship Zip-A.
We've dealt with quantum before, so maybe we can do it again!
ANTONIA: Good luck...
I saw you making photon-antiphoton pairs earlier. It's a good idea, but they've figured it out. Apparently some of those blobs now have grabbed the photons for themselves.
AVA: Oh no! That's the only way I've figured out how to beat them!
ANTONIA: Don't worry! All you have to do is jump on them! Since they're holding a photon they'll probably be distracted, absorb the photon and then emit it, destroying them but not hurting you!
At least, that's how I hope it'll work... I haven't actually tried it.
AVA: Well, thanks for the advice!
Now if only I could get used to jumping in quantum fields...
AVA: Looks like a lot of the base is now free from quantum!
Now I just need to find that Antonia person and see if she can lend us any fuel...
ANTONIA: You called?
AVA: Antonia! Were you just standing there the whole time?
ANTONIA: Maybe...
But you want to steal my fuel and abandon me here on this desolate gas giant, do you?
AVA: What?! Of course not! I thought you lived here! Like Lily lived in the black hole!
ANTONIA: I know, I know, just playing around. I can get you some fuel. Go show those quantum quarks what a Hamiltonian operator's really all about!
AVA: I have no idea what that means, but thanks!
ANTONIA: Don't worry, I don't know either!

Starship Zip-A
Earth Orbit

Above the occupied
capital of the
Amalgamation of Worlds
CINDY: Ava, patch us through to the planet below.
AVA: Of course... but why do you need to dress like that?
CINDY: It's all part of my plan. Maybe we can get down to the surface without a fight.
AVA: Understood.
RADIO: This is Quantum Earth, J.J. Thompson speaking. Amalgamation ship in orbit, identify yourself.
CINDY: I'm uh, Palisade. We've captured this Amalgamation ship and have the notorious Ava Maria St. Janet Crispin VII on board as a prisoner.
AVA: Hey!
CINDY: Shh!
RADIO: The famous Captain Ava, eh? Our leader will be glad to hear that! But wait, Palisade, I don't recognize your name...
CINDY: What? How could you have not heard of me! I'm the greatest space-captain scientist in history! Why I
AVA: Cindy...
CINDY: I mean, uh, I'm new. Not important. Just need to take Ava to the leader right away. By the way, who is our leader? I was curious
RADIO: State the code phrase!
CINDY: It's, uh, shut up and calculate?
RADIO: Nice try! Had you known me, you'd know it's always plum-pudding! Deploying quantum field!
*beep*
CINDY: I hope we have some mirrors left...
AVA: Wait a second... that call was entirely over voice...
AVA: They just keep coming! How dense is this field?!
NELEHU: We complete one, we complete two, three, four... before we know it, we've completed negative one twelfth, and the field has simply become stronger.
CINDY: We can't give up hope... there has to be some way to get through this.
AVA: And what am I supposed to do? If this isn't working I'm not going to keep doing it! I'm the one moving those mirrors around!
CINDY: Look here, Ensign! I am your commanding officer, and
CINDY: Wait, what just happened?
AVA: I'm not detecting the quantum field anymore... we have a straight shot to Earth!
NELEHU: These fields do not simply decohere on their own.
CINDY: Wait, there's an incoming signal...
BLUE ???: Hey Ava! Seemed like you were in a bind!
AVA: Hey, it's you! From Betelgeuse! Glad you managed to get untied!
BLUE ???: With no help from you...
PINK ???: Look, what my friend here means is, we felt bad about what happened on Betelgeuse, and figured we'd make it up to you.
PINK ???: But we can't keep this going forever. Are you ready to beam down to the planet?
CINDY: Ava, are you ready to go down to Earth? I don't know if we'll be able to bring you back up...
AVA: As ready as I'll ever be...
CINDY: Understood. Thanks, Betelgeuse bunnies, we'll take it from here! Ava, prepare for transfer to Earth!
AVA: I've never been to the Amalgamation offices before... definitely didn't expect them to be this bland.
But hopefully it won't be that hard to dislodge quantum... maybe it's alright that I have no plan!
Oh damn, more of them are coming, need to find a place to hide, think Ava, think
MAN: I've got that paperwork you asked for, Canonical Quantizor...
LILY: This had better not be another waste of my time.
MAN: Of course not, Canonical Quantizor! I assure you, all my integrals have been double-checked this time! I used an online solver!
LILY: For your sake, you'd better hope so. Let's discuss this in my office.
MAN: Yes sir! Ma'am! Shut up and calculate!
I'll, uh, pick up that paper too.
AVA: Are they gone?
And was that... Lily?!
AVA: Why would Lily join quantum... and to become their leader! She always hated them, without her help I would never have beaten them in the first place...
Could it be my fault? Is it because I impersonated a captain?
LILY: All these questions and you never bothered to ask? It's been far too long, 'Captain' the Seventh.
AVA: So it really is you... you know, just because Spacefleet is looser with discipline than you expected
LILY: It has nothing to do with your ploy! That was completely irrelevant!
It was even a little... charming...
LILY: You abandoned me inside the black hole! You only cared about yourself and your crew! You couldn't commute that with me...
AVA: But that's not true!
LILY: It's not...
Enough!
Call off the invasion! We've got what we came here for. Back to the black hole!
AVA: Wait, call it off? What are you talking about? You're leaving us?
LILY: We're leaving the Earth... but we're taking you with us!
MEN: Shut up and calculate!
Space Year 99

Immediately following
the Defeat of
Schrodinger's Cat
AVA: Lily, we're heading back to the ship... do you want to come with us?
LILY: I'm not so sure about that, Ava... I can't just leave here.
AVA: I guess that makes sense...
It was really good meeting you, Lily. Maybe we'll see each other again one day!
LILY: Same to you, the Seventh.
LILY: I wonder if I made the right decision...
Goodbye, Ava!
AVA: There's something so unintuitive about this whole situation...
